markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Armor 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Bastion Plate](/Armor.aspx?ID=17)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Bulwark" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=202" />
<trait label="Entrench Melee" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=474" />
<trait label="Hindering" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=479" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 9 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 33 gp

**AC Bonus** +6

**Dex Cap** +0

**Check Penalty** -3

**Speed Penalty** -10 ft.
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Strength** 18

**Bulk** 5

**Category** Heavy

**Group** Plate
</row>

</column>

---

This cumbersome and sturdy plate armor has fluting and additional protection built into the cuirass, helm, pauldrons, and vambraces. Bastion plate was invented for protection in combat tournaments meant to be sporting rather than lethal.

<title level="2">Armor Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 275 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain class features can grant you additional benefits with certain armors. This is called an armor specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which armor group your armor belongs to, as listed below. Only medium and heavy armors have armor specialization effects.

[Click here for the full rules on Armor Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=211).

<document level="2" id="armor-group-4" />

<title level="2">Specific Magic Armor</title>
[Bastion of the Inheritor](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1841), [Immortal Bastion](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1847)
name: Bastion Plate
